intro: Schiedea oahuensis, commonly known as the Oahu snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Oahu. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. The plant grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in coastal cliffs and rocky areas. Schiedea oahuensis is a rare species, listed as endangered due to habitat loss and invasive species. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it a significant subject of botanical study in Hawaii.
